name: Software Work History
subTitle: Software Developer at Yona-Brixtel
content: Current I am currently a developer at Yona-Brixtel in Virginia (as of March 2019). Here I have learned Angular 7 along with PrimeNG and I am working on front end as well as API integration for our CEA project for the FAA. UI and API work. We are currently building this website from scratch. With this job I have a public trust government clearance.

name: Skill Set
content: JavaScript, Angular, PrimeNg, React, React Native, CSS, HTML, MongoDB, API, Express, Micro, Micro-Router, Monk, Git, Jira

name: Non-Software Work History
subTitle: Nomo Pest Solutions and Quick Quack Car Wash
content: While at Helio Training I was working at a car wash in Orem, Utah called Quick Quack Car Wash. I also attended Utah Valley University for a few years while I was deciding what field I wanted to go in. While at UVU I worked both as a salesman and a technician for Nomo Pest Solutions based in Bluffdale, Utah. Both of these jobs made me much better at talking with clients and communicating in general. These jobs have helped me in several ways at my current job as a software developer for Yona-Brixtel. They might not have given me technical skills for the work but they did allow me to learn how to work with people from several different departments at the same time and how to communicate my goals clearly. I learned how to deal with difficult clients and co-workers and help them with questions or concerns they might have.

name: Achievements
content: I am an Eagle-Scout and I have an Eagle Palm to go along with it. This taught me how to organize and plan out large scale events as well as smaller day to day items. I attended and graduated from Helio Training in SLC as a Full-Stack developer. This school taught me how to think as a developer and puzzler.

name: Self Education
content: I have fallen in love with software so I continue my learning/skills outside of work as well. I love the Udemy courses and learning new languages. I have taken stabs at many languages and practices. Whenever I see something cool I always say to myself 'hey I wonder if I could do that'. I love learning, and not just about software.

name: Software Experience
content: I have loved working with other developers, and especially the head and lead developers. I fell I pick up information very quickly and learn tons from them. I never need to be told how to do something twice. I love learning from them and then applying it to my tasks. The software community is amazing and I love how everyone is willing and able to help each other.

name: Books
content: I very much love to read, and by far my favorite thing to read is fantasy. Tolkien started my journey through fantasy worlds and I have fallen in love since. Lord of the Rings will always be one of the greatest stories ever written.

name: Education
subTitle: Helio Training
content: I attended Helio Training in Salt Lake City, Utah. I graduated from Helio December of 2018. Helio is a full-stack software school where I learned how to design and build complete websites from end-to-end. My certificate from there is a certification of course completion and certification in full-stack web development. My final project at school was a full-stack website that was a book tracker. I implemented functionality such as: Create, Read, Update and Delete as well as a fully functional search bar.

name: Favorite Quote
content: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve. - J.R.R. Tolkien
